009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.BilateralF.gauss;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
014
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel2D;
017import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
018
019/**
020 * Scalar version, applicable to all image types.
021 * On color images, this filter is applied separately to each color component.
022 * This class implements a bilateral filter as proposed in
023 * C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images",
024 * Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision,
025 * Bombay, India.
026 * The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all 
027 * image types.
028 * 
029 * @author W. Burger
030 * @version 2021/01/01
031 */
032public class BilateralFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements BilateralF {
033        
034        private final float[][] Hd;     // the domain kernel
035        private final int K;            // the domain kernel size [-K,...,K]
036        private final double sigmaR2;
037        
038        public BilateralFilterScalar() {
039                this(new Parameters());
040        }
041        
042        public BilateralFilterScalar(Parameters params) {
043                GaussianKernel2D kernel = new GaussianKernel2D(params.sigmaD);
044                this.Hd = kernel.getH();
045                this.K = kernel.getXc();
046                this.sigmaR2 = sqr(params.sigmaR);
047        }
048        
049        @Override
050        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
051                float S = 0;                    // sum of weighted pixel values
052                float W = 0;                    // sum of weights               
053                final float a = plane.getVal(u, v); // value of the current center pixel
054                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
055                        for (int n = -K; n <= K; n++) {
056                                float b = plane.getVal(u + m, v + n);
057                                float wd = Hd[m + K][n + K];            // domain weight
058                                float wr = gauss(a - b, sigmaR2);       // range weight
059                                float w = wd * wr;
060                                S = S + w * b;
061                                W = W + w;
062                        }
063                }
064                return S / W;
065        }
066
067}
